creator: Haultain, Theodore Arnold, 1857-1941. (author)
description: Haultain, Theodore Arnold: 1857-1941. Born in India; educated University of Toronto; private secretary to, then literary executor and biographer of, Goldwin Smith; spent later years in England (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // Error in page numbering: [12-40] erroneously numbered 16-44. At head of title: "The souvenir number of the Canadian Historical and Illustrated War News. " Caption title: "Supplement. Honour Roll of the officers, non-commissioned officers and men composing the North-West field force which suppressed the Rebellion of 1885. Two parts in 1 volume. Part 1: Saturday, July 4, 1885. Part 2: Saturday, August 29, 1885." Facsimile reprint, North Vancouver, B.C.: C.G. Bainbridge, 1976 (44p.). See also Peel 1460.
format: [1], 44 [i.e. 40] p., illus., 2 col. double plates.; 40 cm.
subject: Rebellions and Regimental Histories--Saskatchewan Rebellion
